info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 19 at 3:29PM CDT by NWS Little Rock AR
info.description:
At 328 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Shady, or 10 miles north of Umpire, moving north at 5 mph.
HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail.
SOURCE...Radar indicated.
IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible.
Locations impacted include... Mena... Shady... Hartley... Opal... Cossatot River State Park... Bard Springs Recreation Area... Caney Creek Wilderness... Polk County Fairgrounds... Mena Intermountain Airport... Board Camp... Nunley... Shady Lake Recreation Area... Roaring Branch Natural Area... Dallas... Cherry Hill in Polk County...
info.instruction:
If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
